verses.verse: Keep <WH8104> <WH8798> thy foot <WH7272> when thou goest <WH3212> <WH8799> to the house <WH1004> of 'Elohim <WH430>, and be more ready <WH7138> to hear <WH8085> <WH8800>, than to give <WH5414> <WH8800> the sacrifice <WH2077> of fools <WH3684>: for they consider <WH3045> <WH8802> not that they do <WH6213> <WH8800> evil <WH7451>.

Be not rash <WH926> <WH8762> with thy mouth <WH6310>, and let not thine heart <WH3820> be hasty <WH4116> <WH8762> to utter <WH3318> <WH8687> any thing <WH1697> before <WH6440> 'Elohim <WH430>: for 'Elohim <WH430> is in heaven <WH8064>, and thou upon earth <WH776>: therefore let thy words <WH1697> be few <WH4592>.
For a dream <WH2472> cometh <WH935> <WH8802> through the multitude <WH7230> of business <WH6045>; and a fool's <WH3684> voice <WH6963> is known by multitude <WH7230> of words <WH1697>.

When thou vowest <WH5087> <WH8799> a vow <WH5088> unto 'Elohim <WH430>, defer <WH309> <WH8762> not to pay <WH7999> <WH8763> it; for he hath no pleasure <WH2656> in fools <WH3684>: pay <WH7999> <WH8761> that which thou hast vowed <WH5087> <WH8799>.
Better <WH2896> is it that thou shouldest not vow <WH5087> <WH8799>, than that thou shouldest vow <WH5087> <WH8799> and not pay <WH7999> <WH8762>.

Suffer <WH5414> <WH8799> not thy mouth <WH6310> to cause thy flesh <WH1320> to sin <WH2398> <WH8687>; neither say <WH559> <WH8799> thou before <WH6440> the angel <WH4397>, that it was an error <WH7684>: wherefore should 'Elohim <WH430> be angry <WH7107> <WH8799> at thy voice <WH6963>, and destroy <WH2254> <WH8765> the work <WH4639> of thine hands <WH3027> ?
For in the multitude <WH7230> of dreams <WH2472> and many <WH7235> <WH8687> words <WH1697> there are also divers vanities <WH1892>: but fear <WH3372> <WH8798> thou 'Elohim <WH430>.

If thou seest <WH7200> <WH8799> the oppression <WH6233> of the poor <WH7326> <WH8802>, and violent <WH1499> perverting of judgment <WH4941> and justice <WH6664> in a province <WH4082>, marvel <WH8539> <WH8799> not at the matter <WH2656>: for he that is higher <WH1364> than the highest <WH1364> regardeth <WH8104> <WH8802>; and there be higher <WH1364> than they <WH5921>.
Moreover the profit <WH3504> of the earth <WH776> is for all: the king <WH4428> himself is served <WH5647> <WH8738> by the field <WH7704>.

He that loveth <WH157> <WH8802> silver <WH3701> shall not be satisfied <WH7646> <WH8799> with silver <WH3701>; nor he that loveth <WH157> <WH8802> abundance <WH1995> with increase <WH8393>: this is also vanity <WH1892>.

When goods <WH2896> increase <WH7235> <WH8800>, they are increased <WH7231> <WH8804> that eat <WH398> <WH8802> them: and what good <WH3788> is there to the owners <WH1167> thereof, saving <WH518> the beholding <WH7207> <WH8675> <WH7212> <WH8801> of them with their eyes <WH5869> ?

The sleep <WH8142> of a labouring man <WH5647> <WH8802> is sweet <WH4966>, whether he eat <WH398> <WH8799> little <WH4592> or much <WH7235> <WH8687>: but the abundance <WH7647> of the rich <WH6223> will not suffer <WH3240> <WH8688> him to sleep <WH3462> <WH8800>.

There is <WH3426> a sore <WH2470> <WH8802> evil <WH7451> which I have seen <WH7200> <WH8804> under the sun <WH8121>, namely, riches <WH6239> kept <WH8104> <WH8803> for the owners <WH1167> thereof to their hurt <WH7451>.
But those riches <WH6239> perish <WH6> <WH8804> by evil <WH7451> travail <WH6045>: and he begetteth <WH3205> <WH8689> a son <WH1121>, and there is nothing <WH3972> in his hand <WH3027>.

As he came forth <WH3318> <WH8804> of his mother's <WH517> womb <WH990>, naked <WH6174> shall he return <WH7725> <WH8799> to go <WH3212> <WH8800> as he came <WH935> <WH8804>, and shall take <WH5375> <WH8799> nothing <WH3972> of his labour <WH5999>, which he may carry away <WH3212> <WH8686> in his hand <WH3027>.

And this <WH2090> also is a sore <WH2470> <WH8802> evil <WH7451>, that in all points <WH5980> as he came <WH935> <WH8804>, so shall he go <WH3212> <WH8799>: and what profit <WH3504> hath he that hath laboured <WH5998> <WH8799> for the wind <WH7307> ?
All his days <WH3117> also he eateth <WH398> <WH8799> in darkness <WH2822>, and he hath much <WH7235> <WH8687> sorrow <WH3707> <WH8804> and wrath <WH7110> with his sickness <WH2483>.

Behold that which I have seen <WH7200> <WH8804>: it is good <WH2896> and comely <WH3303> for one to eat <WH398> <WH8800> and to drink <WH8354> <WH8800>, and to enjoy <WH7200> <WH8800> the good <WH2896> of all his labour <WH5999> that he taketh <WH5998> <WH8799> under the sun <WH8121> all <WH4557> the days <WH3117> of his life <WH2416>, which 'Elohim <WH430> giveth <WH5414> <WH8804> him: for it is his portion <WH2506>.

Havahry man <WH120> also to whom 'Elohim <WH430> hath given <WH5414> <WH8804> riches <WH6239> and wealth <WH5233>, and hath given him power <WH7980> <WH8689> to eat <WH398> <WH8800> thereof, and to take <WH5375> <WH8800> his portion <WH2506>, and to rejoice <WH8055> <WH8800> in his labour <WH5999>; this <WH2090> is the gift <WH4991> of 'Elohim <WH430>.

For he shall not much <WH7235> <WH8687> remember <WH2142> <WH8799> the days <WH3117> of his life <WH2416>; because 'Elohim <WH430> answereth <WH6031> <WH8688> him in the joy <WH8057> of his heart <WH3820>.
